qas.question: The war from 431-404 BC is known as what?
What often caused strife between Greek states?
Who eventually brought the Greeks together?
Who was the first leader of a unified Greece?

context: <a1_0>Lack of political unity<a1_0/> within Greece resulted in frequent conflict between Greek states. The most devastating intra-Greek war was the <a0_0>Peloponnesian War<a0_0/> (431–404 BC), won by <a2_0>Sparta<a2_0/> and marking the demise of the Athenian Empire as the leading power in ancient Greece. Both Athens and Sparta were later overshadowed by Thebes and eventually <a3_0>Macedon<a3_0/>, with the latter uniting the Greek world in the League of Corinth (also known as the Hellenic League or Greek League) under the guidance of <a4_0>Phillip II<a4_0/>, who was elected leader of the first unified Greek state in history.
